content.description:
This thing is sequencey to the max.  Tons of options, but string the moves wrong and you'll be double-checking the grade.  Once unlocked however, this route is a blast - just don't forget your beta between visits.

 Starting on a light-colored chest-level chossy formation, move left through your choice of crimps and slopers to link up with the second half of Vacant Fractal, hitting increasingly better holds and topping out on ze jugs.  Crux is the move to the first shared hold, a sloper.
content.protection: 2 or more pads, as this route is mostly horizontal.
content.location:
Starts to the right of Vacant Fractal.

 After coming out of the narrow mini canyon, follow the rock wall across from you to the left to a streaky overhung section.  Look for the light-colored chossy start.

content.description:
When I first sighted this line, I didn't think I could do it.  After a few trips out cleaning other things, I gave it a legit attempt and discovered it was within the realm of possibility.  The super-low start is interesting, just wish it was a bit longer and higher.

 Starting low and sideways on a bulgey sloper with meticulous feet out to the right, fire up to a crimp without losing sight of the proximate sloper.  Once established here, move up and left towards the upper jugs and top out.  First move or two is the crux.
content.protection: 2 pads is ideal; the route traverses slightly and there is a large rock to cover.
content.location:
To the left of Vessel in Passing.

 After coming out of the narrow mini canyon, follow the rock wall across from you to the left to a streaky overhung section.  Look for the start bulge.

content.description: The highest quality limestone at Ledge Park can be found within this area.  In addition, the longer approach combined with not having to explain to strangers that you aren't really "soloing" (unless you are) results in complete serenity.  Although only a few routes have been posted so far, there is great potential here for many more problems to be cleaned.  Most of these would probably be on the easier side, but some harder lines may be hiding.
